title: Gragas has the lowest win rate and the lowest pick rate across the board

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Gragas when played Top. Statistics include Gragas's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Gragas Top is Strong or Weak Against.

body: Is there any help planned for him, or is he going to get ignored because his design does not match Riot's direction and he's to be left in limbo, just like Urgot, where Riot doesn't want them to exist, but also can't outright delete / redesign the champion for fear of backlash.

replies.body: {{champion:79}}  I'LL HAVE YOU KNOW I WAS ONCE A *hiccup* CHAMPION *sobs into drink*
That's interesting, because {{champion:103}} has the highest win rate right now, at almost 58%, and is picked or banned 51% of the time. Riot has their favorites.
You do remember that before the changes hit live, half the boards was filled with posts saying that she needed more buffs.
And people were complaining that these changes were massive nerfs? Yea I remember that, lol
I wasn't complaining that they were nerfs, I complained that it would make her less fun, and it did. Now all you do is dash 3 times and they die and its boring AF to play
Except her ult didn't get any changes, in fact it was nerfed because of the removal of her damage amps, both charm and dfg.
If you weren't the one complaining then I wasn't talking about you, lol, there were *a lot* of complaints.

You're hilarious if you think she's their favorite.

Also, that 5.2 change was and remains to be an unwarranted kick in the ribs to assassin Ahri players.  They're bringing her back to what she was originally, not paying attention to how her mage playstyle got her nerfed in the first place, while killing off her role as an assassin completely.  

She's winning a lot more, and she **is** stronger, but this isn't what a lot of us wanted since the playstyle most of us used is no longer possible.  The "compensation" she received pigeon-holed her identity into what RIOT wanted, when at the same time they want to promote diversity.  

This was all done despite us begging them to preserve her assassin identity, and just like her splash art complaints, they were ignored once it went against their ideas.

She's definitely one of their favorites. Just from a demographic and marketing standpoint, Sona, Lee Sin, Ahri are all big fan favorites.

Also, how would having just another mid-lane assassin be "diverse"? Any change is going to have people who like it and people who don't. Some champions have many separate identities and Riot gets flak for that (see Lee Sin for a great example -- a jack of all trades... I also remember Kayle's rework awhile back), so it's natural they'd try to refine champions to fit more closely into a specific idea.
Sona's definitely a favorite among the community, but... not so much a favorite of Riot.

Eh, even if she doesn't get the kind of attention Sona mains would like, the fact that she gets so much attention from Riot seems to indicate she is a favorite of Riot's...

MEANWHILE, {{champion:6}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:154}}

I am glad that Riot brought him back to being a Melee Centric Mage instead of that garbage "I only know how to Q from 1500 range"

However they REALLY need to increase the damage reduction on his W
They just need to make it manaless again.
If he has to channel for 1 second every 4 seconds, he should damn sight be rewarded

His auto animation for an empowered W needs to be smoother and faster. It's probably the clunkiest ability in the game right now. If your empowered Auto from W is cancelled right before you smash the ground it wont deal damage...

Buff W channel time to .75s from 1s and make the empowered Auto much smoother and faster and he'll be great again. His W is way too unreliable for his main ability to deal damage and tank. 

Or allow him to channel while he uses his E which would make for some sick plays. He has too much counterplay in his initiation because his E is slow and you have plenty of time to back off when you see him channel his W.

Agreed that his W is the biggest problem. Ontop of they added a mana cost to that clucky crap just incase gragas players didnt feel beat down enough. That change alone make support gragas not worthwhile as his sustain as a support with his W was one of his biggest benefits to bullying as support.

I also think the making the barrel charge up to do more damage is terrible design because that basically means that two of his abilities have a huge telegraph effect. Enemy sees him channel his W? Back off till it wears off / use minions to block any attempt to bodyslam into you. See him roll out a barrel? Just walk away. Too much of Gragas is countered by just walking away for 2 seconds.

Worst pick and win rate and barely any pro play. Riot will still argue his rework was a success.

They need to make it possible to cancel the channel at will. Right now it's happened on many occasions that I died while drinking because I was unable to E or flash (dunno if the flash thing was a bug). It's the most unresponsive and clunky ability in the game.
Another victim of reworkomania {{champion:72}} {{champion:2}}

i feel like if they just removed the clunky feeling from his W he would be a lot more fun to play and his winrates would improve substantially.  that alone is pretty much the reason i stopped playing him.
The mana cost on W and gutting his Q waveclear was the last nail in the coffin for me.
They really need to remove the reduced damage to minion for his Q

Gragas has 4 aoe's, poke, a gap closer, percentage maximum health, soft cc, hard cc, and sustain. His kit is amazing for the top lane, I just don't think people realize this and can't get past his old identity as a mage. He doesn't need any work done, people just need to realize how strong he actually is in top then he will be picked a lot more.

The problem might also lie in the builds that are listed, they are building nothing but damage even though he is an ap bruiser now not a mage.

The problem of post rework Gragas wasn't the Q that was broken (it was perfectly fine), was the W spamming because of the 0 mana costs , fixing that Gragas would have been perfectly fine. Let the barrel ferment is easy when you have no pressure, but when you has to face enemy laner is not that easy neither always possible. And also, enemies with long range abilities could just work on minion waves positioning to let you miss a good chunk for minions by moving the lane before you can make the barrell ferment or activate it
His E gapclose has very long CD until you get consistent CDR, and it still hit relatively few minions even if minions are positioned  up in a way that he can hit a good number of them with the collision range; you won't hit more than 3-4 minions with the E, while receiving enemy minion damage because you went beyond your minion line, and on top of that putting you in a bad position if you are facing the enemy laner because your minions can't bodyblock the enemy abilities 
As solo laner, against enemy pressure, Gragas has just bad wave clear. He is not bad at splitpushing and clearing an empty lane to defend tower/inhibitor and shove lane back to let your minons take down enemy objectives(also because he has the possibility to escape or at least keep busy multiple enemies with his kit), but the Q damage reduced on minions is a big blow to him as a laner and make him mostly unviable on every role
Items don't support a bruiser AP build very well.

I have always been a believer that Riot cares. As a large company, it sometimes takes them awhile to respond to these situations, but I think threads like this one help move the process along by letting Rioters know that we see this as an issue. I think people don't realize how often reds read these threads. They may not always respond, but I can tell by their balance choices, and by what they say when they DO post, that they are paying attention. I doubt we'll wait long before Gragas sees some love.
